turns.speaker: CINNABAR
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Bill!  Bill?!

turns.speaker: CINNABAR
turns.text: Patrick, he's...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Okay, okay.  Listen:

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Here, find my hand.  The stairs are right near here.  I saw them.  Let's just walk up there.

turns.speaker: CINNABAR
turns.text: I can't find you.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Here!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: We gotta jump!

turns.speaker: CINNABAR
turns.text: I can't!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: We're here.  Where the hell are you?

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: Back here.  At the end of the block.

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: You got the cash?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: You got the shit?

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: Yeah, but you got to come the rest of the way on foot.  Leave your car and walk over here.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Let me see it.

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: Let me see it.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: I can't carry it in my pocket, man.  And I can't go get it for you cause you might be a cop.  You gonna have to pick it up yourself.

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: Don't worry.  It's just round the corner. Halfway down that block, you can't miss it.  Top step of the front stairs, there's a loose stone.  Go on, I ain't shitting you.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Fuck it.  Alright.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: But maybe we're the ones who should be down there.  Doing something.  Making it better.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Can't be done.  That place already died and gone to hell.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Where are we going?  You know I hate surprises.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: A little business move I made.  On my own.  I think you're gonna approve.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: What are we doing down here?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Like you always said, Pop, look for the undervalued.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Listen to me, boy.  I didn't work all my life to get out of this neighborhood for you to move right back in!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I thought you'd be psyched.  Just trying to do what you did.  Take nothing and make something out of it.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: No one'll ever come here.  Shut it down. Don't worry, the bank'll buy it back. I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You'll take care of it?  Not this time. No way.  I bought it fair and square. And we open tonight.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Bullshit!  Bullshit!!  You're selling it back!  That's an order!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Did you do it?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Sure, son.  I went down there and torched the place myself.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You could have had it done.  You didn't want us there.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: I wouldn't have risked killing you to get you out.  I was trying to protect you.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: From what?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why?  Why did you give a shit about the building?  Why did you care that we were there of all places?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: It's...it's a bad neighborhood.  As you can see now.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Bullshit, Dad.  Don't front me.  For once.  Just tell me the truth.  I came from there, too.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: You were just a kid.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I saw your face.  You knew that place. You knew those people.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: That's the past.  It's dead.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Dead?  I don't think your past is dead.  It's alive.  And it bites.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Please...help me...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Dad?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Help me.  I'm so sorry.  But please, help me...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Daddy?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: What the hell do you want?

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Just a visit with my old pal, Jay-bird.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Don't call me that.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: You certainly traded up.  ...the trophy wife.  Nice lookin'.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Keep your hands to yourself, willya?

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: I been watching you.  You done good. Invested wisely.  Respectable businessman now.  Just like you always wanted.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: And you?  Still a pig.  Just a much fatter one.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: No reason to get nasty.  Yeah, I've stayed in the organization.  But then again I never got the percentage you did.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Or you didn't know what to do with it.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Maybe so.  Maybe so.  But that ain't why I came to see you.  You sold the building.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: What building?

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Don't shit a shitter.  Our building. What did you call it?  His 'tomb'?  We had an agreement.  You were supposed to sit on it.  Not sell it --

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: I didn't sell it.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Well, somebody bought it.  That's what I heard.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: You're right.  One of my associates sold the building last month.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: That's a Bozo no-no.  Jay-bird.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Look, even if anyone found anything there, it's twenty years ago.  They could never connect it to us.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: You better hope not.  Cause it's like they say, four can keep a secret, if three are dead.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Nice rack.  How old is --

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: That's it.  Get out.  Now!

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: No way man...

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: You cut him, or I shoot you.  Make your choice.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Not your style.  Is it Eddie?  Killing off your customers?

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: I ain't killed nobody.  Shall I rack 'em?  Play a game, Lupe?

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: No time for eightball.  I got your tip.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Fair enough for the shit.  But I think a little bonus is due for knocking out the competition.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: You was just doing your job.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Last thing you need's for me to start doing my fucking job.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: What it is?  What it will be, muthafucka.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Now you.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: I know it.  The old slaughterhouse.  Hey, Sal.  That little weasel we popped today?  He's got something for us.  I knew he would once he thought about it.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Shit, that was fast.

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: 12-year olds.  They scare easy.  Anyway, he's gonna tip their stash.  Come with me.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I'm on my way home.  Can you handle it yourself?

turns.speaker: LUPOVICH
turns.text: Oh, no.  Please don't make me go by myself.  I'm scaaaaaaaaaared.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Fuckin' comedian.  See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: Goddamnit!  How many times I told you --

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: We got a gift for you, Eddie.  Fresh new BMW.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: That you stole off those white boys was down here last night?  Are you crazy? Everybody from hell to breakfast heard that screamin' on Blackstone last night!

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: How many times I told you, no psycho shit.  There gonna be psycho shit, I'm the one that does it.

turns.speaker: STANK
turns.text: We just thought...

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: No more thoughts from your asses.  Or I will burn your asses and snort the ashes. Hear me?

turns.speaker: WEAZE
turns.text: We didn't do nothing, Eddie.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: You gon tell me you didn't ginsu those punks and steal their ride?

turns.speaker: WEAZE
turns.text: That's all we did, steal their ride.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: Get that car the hell away from here, now!  I spend a lot of money to keep the cops cool.  But this is the kinda shit that pisses everybody off.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: You boys been hitting the pipe?

turns.speaker: WEAZE
turns.text: No, Eddie.  It's just that, I dunno.  He was tall, and thin, and like a shadow, his face was just a blur.  All I remember is the voice.  It was smooth and low and it didn't seem to be comin' out of his mouth.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: Then how'd you hear it, fool?

turns.speaker: WEAZE
turns.text: It was just like in my head.

turns.speaker: MACK
turns.text: Maybe I oughta open a couple holes in that head and let all them voices out. You'll feel better, I promise.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I just accelerated my top secret long term plan for our world domination.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Sqweeep.  We innerup this programme to bring you this special news bulletin --  "Aliens from Reticula 3 have hijacked Patrick Peet and injected moly headcheese into his skull filling his entire brain cavity with cosmic slop..."

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I was planning on waiting until I got the place cleaned out, but -- like the man says, carpe diem.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: And damp, too.  Let's not forget damp.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Whattaya think?  Can you picture it? Over there the bar, and in here -- the dance floor.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Jimmy Bones?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yeah, you heard of him?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You haven't?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Not that I remember.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: He was a local legend back in the '70's. There was a song, Stagolee kinda deal: "This is the ballad of Jimmy Bones/Black as night and hard as stone..."

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I was born near here.  My dad's from here.  He never mentioned it.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You gotta use your imagination.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: "This is Patrick..."  "...And this is Patrick on crack." Imagination, my butt.  Even the space cowboy can't...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why don't y'all check out the rest?  I'm going downstairs and see if I can get the furnace fired up.  Warm this place up, you'll see.  It has serious potential.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Potential toxic dump site.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Yeah right, and which ever of us is still alive at the end of the week inherits all Vincent Price's cash.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Look, you guys want to play college radio, high school reunions, and some fool's club once a week for the rest of your lives, that's cool.  But I think we can do better.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I thought you were bringing the Colonel?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: The Gangster of Love don't eat no fried chicken.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why not?  He eats everything else.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Just what army do you think the Colonel was in?  Everybody knows the whole chicken distribution network is owned by the Klan.  "Special recipe".  I'm telling you.  There's something in the batter. Say it makes a black man sterile.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Maurice, even if it was true, what are you worried about?  Last time I checked, you weren't black.  I'm not sure what the hell you are.  But I know you aren't a black man.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: I am the future.  I am all colors.  All races.  All creeds.  I am the melting pot.  I am the tossed salad.  I am post racial.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Post-toasted's more like it.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: "Like a heartbeat/Like a love beat." Listen to the Di Franco twins there. Just the plumbing or something, fool.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Maybe there's a pipe underneath the floor.  It leaked and stained.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: And some people need their medication tweaked.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: I'm not joking boy.  Don't feed it. It'll only make it hungrier.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Need any help with those bags, Ma'am?

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Not really to live, just to play.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: That building?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Gonna be le hot shit.  Pardon my Francais.  Dance club.  The Resurrection Brothers play there.  Heard of them?

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: Should I?

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: You look mighty familiar to me.  You sure you're not from around here?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I was born near here.  But after my mother died, my dad moved.  I grew up out in Rossmore Park.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: You're pretty black to be growing up in Rossmore Park.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: You sure we oughta save him?  Why not just let see how safe his gates and walls keep him when his past comes calling?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Save him?  What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: ... see there ain't just two parts to a person.  There's three.  Body-Soul and Spirit.  The spirit lives in the blood. It's the wanting that holds body and soul together, and sometimes, the wanting lives on.  Jimmy's blood must still be in the house.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: But the place burned to the ground.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: The blood is still there.  We just gotta figure out where.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It's not safe down there.  The fire started down there.  The whole thing could collapse.

turns.speaker: PEARL
turns.text: Then your father's a dead man and Jimmy Bones is gonna be around a long time.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Well, the bad news is we only made 25 bucks each.

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: How could that be?  The box was packed!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Moe's terms.

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: Illibent?  Who's club is that?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Ours!

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: There wasn't any draft.  That window was closed.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: We're all tired.  Everybody makes mistakes.  Tomorrow in the daylight, everything's gonna look different.

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: Boy, put that thing down.  You can't take that.  Might be evidence.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Evidence of what?

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: Somehow I don't think he stabbed himself in the chest, then buried himself too.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Shit!  Damn dog.  We gonna have to do something about you.

turns.speaker: TIA
turns.text: What we have to do is call the police.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Whoa, whoa.  Come on, he's making too much noise.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: You hear that, bitch?  Be quiet!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Here, put this in his mouth.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: You shouldn't have hit me.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You want to get into this now?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: No, no, Caesar.  Not now.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Glenlivet, right, Gino?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: I'll have whatever Violet's drinking.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: So Caesar, what did it total out at?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Two point one seventy-six.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Come on, Pop, all I want to know is one thing.  Just one thing after he made such a big deal out of it.  I bet it wasn't a big deal.  Was it, Caesar?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What's that, Johnnie?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: The money I bet it was nothing to get it clean, after you made such a fucking big deal ...

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where is this going, Johnnie?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Just admit it, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Admit what?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: That you overreacted.  That you lost it.  Not me.  It was your mistake.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: That's right, I know.  I fucking know.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Open the case!

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: All right!  Where's the key?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You don't need a key.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: How the fuck can I open it?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: The same way you did before.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You don't think I'll do it, do you?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: I think you're fucking crazy!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Where's what?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: The money!

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: Caesar, I don't know what you're thinking here, but if you don't put down that gun --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: The next one blows off your dick.

turns.speaker: JOHNNIE
turns.text: You're a dead man!  A fucking dead man!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: We know how this was done, eh?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Caesar?  What is this?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Ask Johnnie!  Ask your rat-fuck son!

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Caesar!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Gino, your son stole this money to set me up and I can prove it.  Violet!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No, Gino!

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: You aim a gun at me?!  Do you know who I am?!  I am Gino Marzzone.  You understand?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Sit down, Gino!

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: No, Caesar, gimme the gun.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Stay away!

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: We're family, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Gimme the gun.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I can't.  I can't.

turns.speaker: GINO
turns.text: Give it to me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: We make our own choices, we pay our own prices.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: All part of the business.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: All part of the business.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I didn't expect --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What the fuck is going on?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Oh, shit ...

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, this is Corky.  Corky, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I'm sorry, Christ, I thought ... it's fucking dark in here.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: She's doing the work herself.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No shit.  Bianchinni hired you?  You know he's a good friend of mine. |Family, really.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: So, you just got out?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Jesus, Caesar!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What?  It ain't no big fuckin' deal. I know who Don hires.  Did you know he did time himself?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Not bad.  What for?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That's none of your goddamn business, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You're right.  You don't have to tell me, if you don't want to.  I just hope you understand you're among good people here.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What?  Oh, come on, I didn't use one of the good towels.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, I'm serious.  This is too much.  I have to get out of here.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Why?  'Cause you know him?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, what happened?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: It was unbelievable!  Un-fucking- believable!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Just look at this mess I got to deal with.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What are you going to do with it?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I told them to run it through the cycles.  But I guess Gino has plans for it because he's coming here tomorrow night to pick this shit up.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where the hell's the laundry detergent?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Ummm ...  in the linen closet.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Fuck!  Fuck!  How did you ...  Awwww goddammit!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm sorry.  It was an accident.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll get some more.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: There's no time.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Don't be silly, Caesar.  It'll take five minutes.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: They were early.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: They just left, didn't they?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What are you, drunk?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You mean they weren't up here?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No!  They're still on their way.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Because I just saw Johnnie downstairs.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I was getting out of the car when I saw him in the Mercedes.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: It couldn't have been.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: It was him.  I'm positive.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: It's impossible!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, I know Johnnie.  It was him. I screamed when I saw him.  I couldn't believe I missed them.  I knew you were going to be upset so I thought I'd apologize and give Gino the Scotch.  I honked a couple of times but he didn't stop.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Why?  Why would Johnnie do this?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Violet!  Open your fucking eyes!  Johnnie hates me like I hate him!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I hate that little fuck!  I hate him!  I hate him!  I should've done him!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: But you know he did it.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: So what?!  So fucking what?  Use your head, Violet.  The money is gone.  Gino is coming here to get it.  You think he's going to believe me if I tell him his piss-hole son stole it!  Is that what you think? I don't.  You know what I think?  I think I'm a dead man.  I'm one in the brain.  That's what I think!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, what are we going to do?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Got to think this through ...

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, maybe we should run --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Violet, please!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I mean it, Caesar, forget Johnnie, forget the money, let's just go now, before it's too late --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Goddammit, Violet!  Would you just leave me the fuck alone!  Please! Leave!  Now!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: All right, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I got it!  I know what I got to do! I got to get the money.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: The money?  The money's gone.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No.  Johnnie's got it.  All I got to do is get it back.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: But it could be anywhere.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: He didn't have that much time.  He had to pick up Gino.  I bet you he's got it with him.  I bet it's in the car.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: He didn't see you, did he?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: See, right now he doesn't know that I know, that's why he put the paper in the case.  He wants me to hand the case to Gino.  Then there is no doubt it was me.  Gino will put a bullet in me himself.  But it ain't going to happen.  I won't let it! Johnnie ain't going to fuck me!  Not like this!  No way!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: This is insane!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You can't leave.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: The hell I can't!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I need you ...

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Bullshit!  You don't need me!  You've never needed me!  I can't help you! Understand?!  I have to get out.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Violet, I won't let you leave.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: If you're not with me, Violet, then I have to assume you're against me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, this is crazy.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Maybe it is, maybe it isn't.  Maybe you dropped the Scotch by accident. Maybe you didn't.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: It would have been so easy to let him in as you went out.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You don't, you can't believe that ...

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I've seen the way he looks at you. He's always wanted you.  Maybe two million dollars finally bought you.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: All right, Johnnie, you want to play it this way, I can play it this way. You want to know who made a mistake, why don't you open the case.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar ...

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Shut up, Violet!  This is between me and Johnnie.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Tell them!  Tell them!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: For Christ's sake, Johnnie, do what he says.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: ...  maybe three hours.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, what are you going to do?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What do you think we're going to do? We have to find the money.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Once we have the money, then none of this ever happened.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, you just killed Gino Marzzone.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No I didn't.  Not if his body disappears and not if the money is still here.  Then they never showed up.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What happened to them?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I don't know.  We may never know, but I'm going to guess it was a job, maybe the Karpoli family.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Fuck.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, what are we going to do?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: They're just cops.  Stall them as long as you can.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Fuck!  Fuck!  Fuck!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, someone could see us out here.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: It's not here, Caesar.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where, then?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I don't know.  it could be anywhere. We don't even know if he was alone. Please, Caesar, we don't have much time.  Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: We're going to need some time.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Who are you going to call?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I can use Johnnie's car, dump it in Lake Michigan ...  I need plastic bags ...  tape and rope ...

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Just hurry.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where is the money?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Don't tell him --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Shut up, Violet!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: He can't kill you --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Violet!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Not until he has the money!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Stupid cunt!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, stop acting like an asshole and think --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Don't try to tell me what to do.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You need the money just like we do.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Shut up, Violet.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Let us go and we'll make a deal.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What did she do to you?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Everything you couldn't.
